citation.article-title: Description of Oceanospirillum kriegii sp. nov. and O. janaschii sp. nov. and assignment of two species of Alteromonas to this genus as O. commune comb. nov. and O. vagum comb. nov.

p.s: Description of Oceanospirillum jannaschii sp. nov.

Oceanospirillum jannaschii (jan.nasch'i.i gen. n. jannaschii of Jannasch; named for H. W. Jannasch, a German microbiologist and a pioneer in marine microbial ecology who has made many important contributions)
Straight rods 1.0 μm-l.4 μm in width to 2.4 μm-3.2 μm in length; motile by 1-2 flagella at one pole.
Utilize 39-46 organic compounds including fatty acids, tricarboxylic acid cycle intermediates, alcohols, amino acids, and amines.
Do not utilize carbohydrates or aromatic compounds.
Of the new species of Oceanospirillum, it is the only one able to reduce NO3- to NO2- and utilize δ-aminovalerate and histamine.
The mol% G+C content in the DNA is 56-57.
